IMPAIRMENT OF NON-FINANCIAL ASSETS EXCLUDING GOODWILL — At the end of each reporting period, the Group reviews the carrying amounts of its non-financial assets to determine whether there is any indication that those assets have suffered an impairment loss. If any such indication exists, the recoverable amount of the asset is estimated in order to determine the extent of the impairment loss (if any). Where it is not possible to estimate the recoverable amount of an individual asset, the Group estimates the recoverabie amount of the cash-generating unit to which the asset belongs.
